channel.title: TODO List
channel.description:
[b]Pre-Beta TODO:[/b] [ul][li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,491906.0.html]Make the RSC client to run inside of MoparScape 4[/url] - started but hit a snag...[/li] [li]Re-factor pretty much the entire thing... There is so much duplicate/misplaced code it's not even funny[/li] [li]Add sending of mouse/keyboard events - I was thinking maybe use an agent for it, and have it sent separately, along with the current mouse position/camera rotation for things like attacking, picking up, interactions...[/li][/ul]
[b]Post-Beta TODO:[/b] [ul][li]Highscores[/li][/ul]
What else needs to be done?
Staff -- just edit in what else needs to be done.

item.title: TODO List
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Moparisthebest:

As to hiscores, the server shouldn’t know or care about those, all of the stat/xp info is in the database, right? If so (it should be) then a web script like php can be written up later to make a hiscores list.

I think we all know that

Its something that needs to be done and this is a TODO list amIright?

Read full topic

item.title: TODO List
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Really nothing that works should be completely removed, maybe put in an option to disable it in the config file, but don’t remove it entirely. Mod and admin commands should be left, unless you mean commands to spawn and change stats, those can be removed or disabled through config.

As to hiscores, the server shouldn’t know or care about those, all of the stat/xp info is in the database, right? If so (it should be) then a web script like php can be written up later to make a hiscores list.

Read full topic

item.title: TODO List

item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

MoparClassic / GameServer / src / org / moparscape / msc / gs / plugins / extras / Quiz.java
Remove the “quiz” client sided and server sided.

Double check the submitReport method. When I was cleaning up the source a bit I came across something, can’t remember it off the top of my head.

Debatable: Move WorldLoader class to “core” just an idea as I am personally tired of looking at the io folder.

CommandHandler.java
::time command… lets get rid of it and make it appear client sided in the “info” tab?
-Remove Mod/Admin commands completely?

Read full topic

item.title: TODO List
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Of course you can refactor it and move parts to more “logical” locations. It just takes a lot of time to succeed.

Separate the entire project into different layers (there’s a design pattern called “Layers”, that you can look up) and move the parts that belong to the domain of RuneScape Classic into one layer (usually called the “Domain Layer”) (using a design pattern called “Domain Model”). The server implementation and its “PacketHandlers” could be added to another layer (usually called the “Application Layer”). All other code can be considered part of a third layer (usually called the “Infrastructure Layer”).

I have started this process already, but not had time the last one and a half week because of my new job. But hopefully I will have time soon again. Anyway, I also changed the layers into their own projects called “org.moparscape.msc." (I also updated their respective package names to the same names). The "” in this case means one of “domain”, “server”, “server.world”, “server.login”, “network”, “network.mina” and “launcher”.

The Launcher uses Spring Framework and its IoC container to start. I probably will add Aspects for logging etc. later on.

Read full topic

item.title: TODO List
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:5, topic:394802”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=491985.msg3597696#msg3597696 date=1305282622]

You can’t really refactor without having a clue on what direction you’re going.

That’s not true… There are hundreds, if not thousands of lines worth of duplicate code; things are randomly scattered about that can be moved to a more logical location, etc…
[/quote]

Removing duplicated code yes, but moving to a logical location not so much (if the logical location changes based on what direction you’re going)[/quote]

So what if it changes? It takes a matter of seconds to move something…

Read full topic
